property.name: text
property.value: WTF, how could it work for the agile board!!!!

property.name: text
property.value: This actor model the reception of a packet from the radio point of view. Once a packet is received, the actor wait a certain time before to deliver it to the mac layer. Moreover, here we can check if the packet is valid or what type it is

svg.text: The state machine that models the radio reception behavior

property.name: script
property.value:
# This is a template. import time import ptolemy.data class Main : "This actor takes a double value and format the double according to the format" def fire(self) :
dataToken = self.data.get(0) format = self.format.getToken().stringValue() formatted_double = format % dataToken.doubleValue() self.out.broadcast(ptolemy.data.StringToken(formatted_double)) return

property.value: isSync==true && endOfFrame_isPresent && fromPhysical_isPresent && isLastPacketValid == true && ackRequired == true

property.name: annotation
property.value: do (// synchronize to the received packet iif I'm not a DAGroot and this is my preferred parent)

property.name: guardExpression
property.value: isSync==true && endOfFrame_isPresent && fromPhysical_isPresent && isLastPacketValid == true && ackRequired == false

property.name: annotation
property.value: if you are able to take a buffer: calculate time correction and add it to the ack, find the frequency, upload packet, and enable the radio

property.name: script
property.value: # This is a template. import time import ptolemy.data class Main : "This actor takes a double value and convert to an int" def fire(self) : dataToken = self.data.get(0) intValue = int(dataToken.doubleValue()) self.out.broadcast(ptolemy.data.IntToken(intValue)) return
